alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 15 at 12:48PM AKDT until March 17 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Snow Followed by Heavy Rain for Southeast Alaska... .Snow continues to fall over the central and northern Panhandle through Thursday. Higher confidence that the far northern Panhandle, including Haines and Skagway, will see heavy snow. Timing of the warming temperatures and the change snow over to rain for the Icy Strait Corridor is less certain with a delayed change. 2 to 5 inches of snow is still expected over the Icy Strait Corridor but possibly more with the delayed change to rain. For Yakutat by Thursday evening the main plume of moisture is expected to shift to west, increasing the possibility for Yakutat to see significant snow accumulations. Yakutat`s snow accumulations will be extremely dependent on where the plume of moisture develops so this trend will be monitored closely throughout this event. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Yakutat. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates possible late Thursday night.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
